title: What were the Wimbledon results?
description: Wimbledon continued on Tuesday when top seed Jannik Sinner began his campaign with a straight-sets victory against Luca Nardi. Seven-time champion Novak Djokovic needed four sets to oust Alexandre Muller. Several seeded players were upset, including third seed Alexander Zverev and seventh seed Lorenzo Musetti. html:
Wimbledon

Sinner, Djokovic win; Zverev falls in five

July 01, 2025

Ezra Shaw/Getty Images

Wimbledon main-draw action runs until 13 July. By ATP Staff

Wimbledon continued on Tuesday when top seed Jannik Sinner began his campaign with a straight-sets victory against Luca Nardi. Seven-time champion Novak Djokovic needed four sets to oust Alexandre Muller.

Several seeded players were upset, including third seed Alexander Zverev and seventh seed Lorenzo Musetti.

View some of Tuesday's key results from the All England Club below and click here to see all scores.

Centre Court
Barbora Krejcikova (CZE) d. Alexandra Eala (PHI) 3-6, 6-2, 6-1
Arthur Rinderknech (FRA) d. Alexander Zverev (GER) 7-6(3), 6-7(8), 6-3, 6-7(5), 6-4
Novak Djokovic (SRB) d. Alexandre Muller (FRA) 6-1, 6-7(7), 6-2, 6-2

No. 1 Court
Jannik Sinner (ITA) d. Luca Nardi (ITA) 6-4, 6-3, 6-0
Taylor Fritz (USA) d. Giovanni Mpetshi Perricard (FRA) 6-7(6), 6-7(8), 6-4, 7-6(6), 6-4
Emma Navarro (USA) d. Petra Kvitova (CZE) 6-1, 6-1
Jack Draper (GBR) d. Sebastian Baez (ARG) 6-2, 6-2, 2-1 ret.
Dayana Yastremska (UKR) d. Coco Gauff (USA) 7-6(3), 6-1

Read More from Wimbledon:
Zverev, Gauff among record seeds exodus
Djokovic's journey from 'best to worst' leads to second round
Healing Harris: From 'absolutely no quality of life' to redemption
